is helping them as well as Lux often vantage power so what is IOT analytics
and build this out excellent it's a service that helps you process
enrich store analyze and visualize IOT data for manufacturers and enterprises we ended up talking to a bunch of
customers and customers told us that the biggest challenges that they had was IOT data is noisy it contains a lot of gaps
in false readings and what they really wanted to be able to do is figure out a way to help filter process and enrich
that data store it both in its raw form and in a processed form and be able to
easily query that data and create datasets so they can run advanced analytics on top of or visualize so
what's the workflow looked like prior to analytics today IOT analytics is able ingest data natively from IOT core
through the IT core rules engine we can also ingest data from any other source like s3 or Kinesis through our put
message API that data makes its way into a channel Channel is the entry point
into the IOT analytics that data will then be sent to a pipeline that you can
authorize you'll be able to transform and enrich and filter the messages that you're sending to the service the
process data will make its way to a processed data store and on top of this you can query to create these data sets
these data sets can be specific by asset a region a time period whatever you're
looking for these datasets can then be used to go into visualization tools or
you can do advanced analysis on top of them I really hate this animation
cool so the first component is a channel it's the entry point in diary analytics
we're able to like I said pull data in from a variety different sources
we're data format agnostic so we can ingest binary or JSON but it's important to note that if you're going to give us
a binary payload you're gonna have to decode it inside the pipeline because we're not going to know how you encoded
it and then with it as well as any other aw service we're lastingly scalable in our ingestion the data it comes in from
a channel is then sent to a pipeline and you can have a channel feed a number of
different pipelines so there's an end-to-end relationship here and in these pipelines you can do filtering so
you can purge outliers remove any a revelant irrelevant data that you have you can do some transformation so
typically we have customers that are taking amperage readings and converting it to a variable or they're converting
Celsius to Fahrenheit things like that you can then enrich so we have the ability to pull in data from the MQTT
topic header device registry and device shadow and embed that inside the JSON
payload then we also provide you the ability to do custom pre-processing so lambda the Swiss Army knife allows you
to reach out into any other service you can pull in information from an external weather source your ERP system whatever
you need and embed that inside the JSON payload as well two important things to
note when it comes to pipelines the first is that we batch messages every 30 seconds we do this prior to enrichment
for two reasons allows us to make sure that your pipelines will scale effectively but also we don't want to
can our consume all of your lambda fleet and so we're looking to help you be a little bit more cost efficient when it
comes to deploying lambda and then we also make it really easy for you to replicate your pipelines at the channel
level we store a raw a mutable data store for you of all the messages that
have come through that channel and then what you can do is you can replicate a pipeline you can change it maybe you
want to do a little bit a B testing and then you can replay the data from a channel through that pipeline and test and see if it's doing
exactly what you expect we have two different types of data stores I touched
on one which is this authoritative store of raw data that lives at the channel
this is immutable because customers asked they needed the ability to have
audit ability for all the messages that are coming in and they also want to be able to replay that data through
multiple different pipelines to test hypotheses a lot of their data scientists to be a little bit more agile
we also have a process data store and this is optimized for time series and
IOT workloads so it's partitioned by time and it's more than a single
database so we've actually created an abstraction layer and what this allows us to do is as we build out new
technologies we can just slide them underneath and you get the different types of data stores in the future and then across all of our data stores we
give you manageable data retention policies so if you want to store your data for a day two days 60 days whatever
your requirement is you can offer those retention policies individually at the processed data store and the raw data
store data sets are kind of the workhorse of the service they are the
result of running sequel queries on top of the data store process data store
these queries can be run ad hoc or scheduled they result in a popular tabular format you can then pull these
data sets into quick site so that you can actually inspect and take a look at those data sets you can also have access
to them via an API console download or you can pull them into Jupiter notebooks or containers and then because the
service is built so data scientists and data engineers can use it we built a console query editor that will allow you
to then run write your sequel queries run them and have access to the resulting data set as I mentioned you're
able to take those data sets and push them into Jupiter notebooks through our integration with sage maker so this
allows you to build your machine learning models and then you can
actually container out those Jupiter notebooks and deploy them back into the service so you can build
and train your models to help you get started we've provided a couple ml
notebook templates for predictive maintenance anomaly detection fleet segmentation and forecasting these are
for if you don't have a lot of experience with machine learning so they're pretty basic but they're great
starting points to get you up and running and then anything that you've
built in Sage Maker you can pull in data sets from IT analytics and run those notebooks on top of the data sets also
if you have your own containers you've built out your own custom analysis if
you can bring that docket container into the container registry we can then
deploy that container inside the service to run on our data sets and then you can
even visualize the container the Jupiter notebook containers the outputs in the
console so again we're trying to build this with data engineers and data scientists in mind customers want to
make sure that they didn't have to scan the history of all their data every single time they wanted to recreate a data data set so we provide them an
ability to do incremental data sets so you can scan incremental amounts of the
data store and then the resulting data set you can then do any kind of analytics that you need to do this
allows you to increase your performance and it helps to reduce costs one of the
fun features of the service and useful ones is you can actually schedule your queries and containers so what this
means is you can as debt is coming in to the service you can schedule the query
to run and the resulting data set can then be pulled into a container that you've already deployed into the service
and it will execute that container and then do whatever you want to do whatever
you want the container to actually do so it allows you to automate these analytical workflows so if you built
your machine learning model inside of Sage maker you've trained it on top of IOT analytics data sets you're then able
to essentially operationalize these containers so that you have an end
